document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_purpose: To ensure unique identification of individuals and systems accessing the organisation's information and other associated assets and to enable appropriate assignment of access rights
control.control_objective: Manage the full lifecycle of identities for all entities (human and non-human) to enable controlled access to information and resources

iso_27001_definition.official_text: The full lifecycle of identities should be managed.
key_requirements: Full lifecycle management of identities implemented
Identities cover both human and non-human entities
Creation, modification, and destruction processes documented
Approval processes for identity lifecycle events
Business justification for all identities maintained

identity_management_overview.definition: Identity management is an evolution of user access management that covers the entire lifecycle of digital identities for all entities
framework_components: Technologies to implement and monitor identities
identity_management_overview.key_concept: Framework of policies, processes and technologies to ensure that the right entities have the right access to the right resources
identity_management_overview.identity_representation: Identities are virtual representations allowing access to data and resources, used to control, monitor and report on what people and systems do and are doing

entity_types.description: Identities can represent multiple entity types

non_human_identities.definition: Digital identities representing systems, services, and automated processes

entity_types.treatment: Human and non-human identities are treated equivalently from a management perspective

implementation_requirements.requirement: Implement Approval Process for Identity Lifecycle
implementation_requirements.description: Establish formal approval process for creating, modifying, revoking and deleting identities

details.segregation_of_duty: The person making the request cannot be the person that approves it - segregation of duty principle must be enforced
details.audit_trail: Maintain audit trail of all approvals (email copies, ticketing system records, etc.)
details.variations: Process may vary slightly or be tightened based on circumstances (e.g., third party accounts, administrative/superuser identities require enhanced controls)

implementation_requirements.description: For all identity types, business case and/or justification must be documented and included in approval process

details.purpose: Understand why the identity is being created, allowing approvers to make informed decisions and maintaining control
details.special_attention: Administrative and superuser accounts require particular scrutiny - these have special powers and can cause significant harm or access everything
details.benefit: Enables understanding of what access is needed and why, supporting access control decisions

implementation_requirements.requirement: Verify Identity of Entity Before Creation
implementation_requirements.description: When an entity requests an identity to be created, modified or deleted, the requestor and the entity (where relevant) are appropriately verified and checked

details.principle: Zero trust approach - verify entities before creating virtual representations

human_identities.requirement: For human identities, verify the person is who they claim to be
human_identities.approach: Use common sense verification - not necessarily passport/photo ID level but reasonable verification
human_identities.caution: Be alert to phishing attempts designed to get personnel to create unauthorized accounts

non_human_identities.requirement: Verify the entity and the technical need
non_human_identities.approach: Confirm system/service existence and legitimacy of automation need

implementation_requirements.description: Identity creation must be performed by qualified personnel with proper configuration

details.personnel_requirement: Must be performed by someone with expertise and experience
configuration_steps: Modify permissions to reflect role-based access or creation request
Enforce default credentials to be changed at first opportunity
details.critical_point: DO NOT USE DEFAULT IDENTITY PASSWORDS - default credentials and identities are easily discoverable online
details.default_settings: Default permissions are not designed to meet specific organizational needs

implementation_requirements.description: Identity configuration must reflect approved request and business needs, not system defaults

details.personnel_requirement: Should be done by someone with expertise and experience
details.configuration_consideration: Easy to create accounts but requires experience to configure properly to meet approved needs
details.principle: Customize configuration to meet business requirements, not defaults
details.security_imperative: Never use default passwords - they are publicly available and security risk

implementation_requirements.requirement: Implement One User to One ID Principle
implementation_requirements.description: For human entities, identities should be unique to enable accountability and access control

details.primary_principle: One human to one unique ID where possible
details.accountability: Unique identity allows tracking of what each human has done if issues occur
details.access_control: Enables control of what each human has access to and can do
details.user_training: Personnel trained on policies prohibiting sharing of login information and consequences of sharing
details.enforcement: Policy documentation and awareness training required

implementation_requirements.requirement: Allow Shared Identities Where Operationally Necessary
implementation_requirements.description: Standard allows for multiple people using one ID where required for business or operational needs with appropriate documentation

details.requirement: Multiple persons sharing one ID only where exceptional business or operational needs exist
details.approval_process: Approval processes must specifically account for shared identities
details.usage: Sparing use in exceptional circumstances only
details.caveat: Standard assumes one-user-one-ID as default approach

implementation_requirements.description: System and non-human identities require approval processes and periodic oversight

details.approval_process: Same approval process required for system and non-human identities as human identities
details.periodic_oversight: Recommend monthly reviews of all service accounts
review_scope: Check configuration of ID and permissions
Ensure no orphaned or forgotten accounts
details.automation: Automated processes creating identities should also remove/disable identities when no longer required

implementation_requirements.description: Identities no longer required must be removed, disabled or deleted promptly

triggering_events: Offboarding of contractors or third parties
Automated expiration based on business need
details.process: Processes such as leaver process and off-boarding as well as automated processes remove or disable identities
details.monitoring: Reviews and audits check that identities no longer required are handled appropriately in timely manner
details.risk: Failure to remove old IDs leaves orphaned accounts that can be compromised or abused

implementation_requirements.description: Identities must never be duplicated or copied; naming must be consistent across systems

details.principle: One user, one entity to one ID maintained everywhere possible
details.duplication_prohibition: Identities are never duplicated or copied to create new identities
details.naming_consistency: Entity must be called by one name consistently across all systems
details.example: If entity is called 'Brian' in IT, it must be called 'Brian' everywhere - not 'Anna' in HR
details.cross_system_mapping: Avoid mapping same entity to different names across systems
details.standard_intent: Prevent confusion and ensure clear audit trails

implementation_requirements.description: Records of significant identity management and usage events must be maintained

details.scope: Logging and monitoring of identities and administrative actions is mandatory
details.definition: Significant events are those determined appropriate for your systems
details.guidance: Consult industry norms for systems in use and think about key event types
details.logging_principle: Do not log everything indiscriminately - focus on significant events you will actually review
details.event_determination: Events determined as appropriate considering creation, modification and deletion
details.record_retention: Once events determined, they are recorded and records are kept
details.purpose: Enable audit trail and investigation of security events

identity_management_process.description: Standard identity management process typically consists of these lifecycle stages

process_stages.name: Request for Identity/Access
process_stages.description: Identity is requested by someone (requestor, manager, system administrator)
details: Justification for creation of identity included

process_stages.name: Approval
process_stages.description: Request is formally approved by authorized personnel
details: Approval conducted by someone senior in organization
Approval from system owner and/or data owner

process_stages.name: Implementation
process_stages.description: Identity is created and access granted
details: Permissions modified to reflect role-based access
Default credentials forced to change at first opportunity

process_stages.name: Modification
process_stages.description: Identity is modified during its lifecycle based on business need

process_stages.name: Destruction/Removal
process_stages.description: Identity is disabled and ultimately deleted when no longer required
details: Triggered by leaver process, offboarding, or business need cessation
Follow-up verification that identity is removed
Account data archived per retention policy

identity_management_principles.description: Core principle guiding identity management decisions
identity_management_principles.principle_statement: Each human entity should have one unique identity to enable accountability, access control, and audit trail
identity_management_principles.flexibility: Standard allows exceptions where business or operational needs require shared identities, with appropriate documentation and controls

steps.action: Establish and communicate Identity Management Policy
steps.detail: Create comprehensive policy covering identity lifecycle, approval processes, and user responsibilities

steps.action: Implement approval process for identity creation
steps.detail: Establish formal process with segregation of duty, business case requirement, and audit trail
Define how requestors and entities are verified before identity creation
Define standards for identity creation, configuration, and activation by qualified personnel
Create formal processes for onboarding new personnel, moving between roles, and offboarding
Establish schedule for regular reviews of human and non-human identities (recommend monthly for service accounts)
Enable logging of significant identity events and establish review procedures
Deploy technology to manage identity lifecycle and maintain audit trails

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with identity management

mistakes.mistake: People have left but they still have an account
mistakes.description: Access to systems not removed when personnel or third parties leave the organization
mistakes.impact: Security risk - departed personnel retain access to systems and data
mistakes.prevention: Implement and rigorously follow leaver process and offboarding procedures
mistakes.action: Ensure access to systems is up to date and that people or third parties that have left no longer have access or accounts

mistakes.mistake: Third parties have open-ended access they do not need
mistakes.description: Third parties granted continuous access rather than time-limited, purpose-specific access
root_cause: No process for third party access
mistakes.example: Third party brought in to fix issue - given permanent access instead of temporary fix access
mistakes.correct_approach: Grant access only when needed for specific purpose, remove when purpose complete
mistakes.prevention: Process must grant access when required and remove when not needed
mistakes.best_practice: Time-limited, purpose-specific access for all third parties

mistakes.mistake: Document and version control is wrong
mistakes.description: Poor document version control and maintenance of identity management documentation and procedures
issues: Version numbers don't match where used
prevention: Keep document version control up to date
Ensure version numbers match where used
mistakes.impact: Massive own goal - shows lack of control and organization

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 5.16 audit

audit_areas.description: Auditor checks that rules, procedures and identity management processes are documented and followed
checks: Rules and procedures documented for identity lifecycle
Approval process documented with segregation of duty
Evidence of following documented procedures
Audit trail of approvals maintained
Recent hires have approval documentation
Granted access matches what was requested and approved
Admin accounts inventory reviewed
Unused or forgotten accounts identified
audit_areas.easiest_win: Request admin accounts from systems - likely to find forgotten, orphaned, or unauthorized admin accounts (9 out of 10 times)
audit_areas.best_practice: Maintain documented evidence of all identity management activities

audit_areas.description: Verify documented procedures exist, are followed, and personnel are trained
checks: Documented procedures for identity creation exist
Documented procedures for identity modification exist
Documented procedures for identity removal exist
Procedures are followed in practice
Evidence of personnel training on procedures
Leaver process documented and followed
No access remains for departed personnel
No accounts for former employees or contractors remain
Approval process evident in operation
audit_areas.biggest_gotcha: People with accounts who have left the organization - evidence of no leaver process or process not followed
audit_areas.red_flag: Finding former employee accounts still active

audit_areas.description: Review documentation, audit trails and identity records for completeness and accuracy
checks: Identity policies documented and current
Identity procedures documented and current
All identities recorded with assignment information
Business justification documented for identities
Approval records maintained with audit trail
Identity review records maintained
Audit logs for significant identity events
Documentation up to date and reviewed in last 12 months
Version control accurate
audit_areas.warning: Poor documentation quality is a massive own goal

audit_areas.description: Verify identity management process stages are implemented in operation
checks: Request process: Business justification required and obtained
Approval process: Segregation of duty enforced, approvals documented
Implementation process: Identity created by qualified personnel, configured appropriately
Modification process: Changes follow approval process
Destruction process: Identities removed when no longer required

audit_areas.description: Verify system and service account management and oversight
checks: System accounts approved and documented
Service accounts approved and documented
Non-human identities reviewed periodically
Unused service accounts identified and removed
Default passwords changed or non-existent
Administrative account inventory complete

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: Identity management is foundational to protecting all critical gambling systems - enables accountability, access control, and audit trails for all system access

identity_requirements: Strict one-user-one-ID principle enforced
Unique identities for all personnel accessing customer data
Enhanced verification before identity creation (payment card data, authentication credentials)
Rapid removal of identities upon employment termination
Regular reviews of customer data access identities
Audit trail of all customer information access
Third party access time-limited and purpose-specific
Administrative access to customer systems tightly controlled
Minimal personnel identities with access (principle of least privilege)
All RNG access identities pre-approved and documented
Enhanced verification before RNG system access identity creation
Separation of duties - different identities for creation, testing, monitoring
Continuous monitoring of RNG access activity
Immediate identity removal if access no longer needed
Audit trail of all RNG system access and modifications
No shared identities for RNG access - strict one-user-one-ID
Read access identities separated from write access identities
Business justification required for write access identities
Audit trail of all modifications to game state and results
Identity-based access control to audit trail itself
Regular reviews of game state modification identities
Approval required for any identity gaining game state write access
Monitoring of all game state access by identity

specific_requirements.system: System Access Points and Entry/Exit Controls
identity_requirements: All system access through registered identities
Access point identities logged and monitored
Failed access attempts logged by identity
Unregistered access attempts detected and escalated
Identities for system access points reviewed periodically
Service account identities for automated monitoring
Network access identities managed through identity lifecycle process
Service identities for network devices approved and documented
Network segment access controlled by identity
VPN and remote access identities enhanced verification
Network access identities monitored for unusual activity
Removal of network access identities per leaver process

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must implement comprehensive identity management covering all personnel and systems with documented lifecycle processes, approvals, and audit trails across all critical systems as defined in RTS Chapter 4

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Manage complete lifecycle of identities (human and non-human) to ensure accountability, enable appropriate access control, and provide audit trails for all system access and actions
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Critical - identity management is foundational to all access control and audit trail requirements
key_principles: One user to one unique identity (where operationally possible)
Approval process with segregation of duty
Immediate removal of identities no longer required
Regular review and oversight of identities
Comprehensive logging of identity management events
Documented procedures for all identity lifecycle stages
Unique naming convention across all systems

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 5.16 Identity Management, implement the following

requirements.requirement: Implement process for creating, updating and removing IDs
requirements.detail: Formal documented process covering all lifecycle stages
Segregation of duty, business case required, audit trail maintained

requirements.requirement: Include business case/justification in approval process
requirements.detail: All identity creations require documented business reason

requirements.requirement: Have HR leaver process that removes user identities
requirements.detail: Formal process ensuring access removed upon employment termination
Periodic reviews (monthly recommended for service accounts) of all identities
Significant events recorded and audit trail maintained
Procedures documented, version controlled, reviewed annually
Personnel aware of identity sharing prohibitions and consequences

prerequisite_controls: ISO 27001 A 5.1 - Policies for information security
ISO 27001 A 5.9 - Inventory of information and other associated assets
dependent_controls: ISO 27001 A 6.5 - Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
cross_references: Access Control (A 5.15) - applies access rights determined by identity management
Authentication Information (A 5.17) - manages credentials for identities
Access Rights (A 5.18) - assigns rights to identities
Privileged Access Rights (A 8.2) - manages special identities with elevated access

process_best_practices: Implement robust joiner/mover/leaver processes that are consistently followed
Require business justification for all identity creation - enforce at process level
Use ticketing system or formal approval mechanism to maintain audit trail
Periodic review schedule - monthly for service accounts, quarterly for human identities
Implement automated identity removal where possible (e.g., for contractors at contract end)
Regular training for personnel on identity policies and procedures
technical_best_practices: Implement identity management platform/tool where possible
Enforce unique identity naming across all systems
Automatic password change requirement at first login
Disable default passwords or credentials completely
Centralized logging of identity management events
Automated alerts for significant identity events
Regular reconciliation of active identities against HR records
documentation_best_practices: Maintain comprehensive asset register of identities
Document all identity procedures with version control
Keep approval records and audit trails
Regular documentation review and update (at least annually)
Remove comments from final procedure documents
governance_best_practices: Executive sponsorship for identity management program
Clear accountability for identity lifecycle stages
Regular reporting on identity metrics (new identities, removed identities, orphaned accounts)
Identity audit committee or review board
Integration with HR systems for automatic termination notification

high_risk_areas.risk: Admin accounts with elevated privileges pose highest security risk if mismanaged
high_risk_areas.control: Maintain inventory of all admin accounts, document purpose and holder, regularly review

high_risk_areas.risk: Contractors, vendors, support personnel may have access longer than necessary
high_risk_areas.control: Time-limited identities, automatic expiration, monthly review of third party accounts

high_risk_areas.risk: Personnel accessing customer payment data, authentication data, account balances
high_risk_areas.control: Strict approval, limited personnel, frequent reviews, audit trail of all access

high_risk_areas.risk: Access to RNG determines game integrity and fairness
high_risk_areas.control: Minimal access, enhanced verification, separation of duties, continuous monitoring

regulatory_expectations: UKGC expects identity management as fundamental security control
Identity records must support audit and investigation
Access accountability through unique identities is mandatory expectation
Rapid removal of access upon employment termination is minimum expectation
Compliance approach should document controls for each critical system type
